sect2.title: Preparing for Installation on IBM eServer p5, System p, and OpenPower Models
sect2.para: This section covers the preparatory steps for installing &slsreg; on IBM eServer p5 systems. It explains the installation from a built-in CD-ROM drive and over the network.
This section assumes you have set up your HMC and connected it to your system. Find more information about using the wizard to configure the HMC in Configuring the HMC using the Guided Setup Wizard:

sect3.title: Modern Features of IBM eServer p5 Systems
sect3.para: IBM eServer p5 systems offer the possibility of partitioning the system. This enables the concurrent operation of up to 254 operating systems on one machine. These operating systems are installed in LPARs (logical partitions). One or several of these partitions can contain a &sls; environment.
To prepare an LPAR for &sls;, first configure the system over the HMC. Refer to the IBM documentation for details:

sect3.title: Hard Disk Space
sect3.para: Make sure that you have sufficient hard disk space for installing &sls;. The standard system requires at least 4 GB of free hard disk space.

sect3.para: &sls; can be installed from a CD-ROM or DVD drive or using a network installation source. Make the CD-ROM, DVD drive, or network device available to the LPAR to install.

procedure.title: Assigning a CD-ROM or DVD Drive to an LPAR

step.para: Open the HMC application and go to Server and Partition Server Management.
From the available servers, expand the server and partition to install.
Right-click the profile to use for installation and select Properties—see .
In the Logical Partition Profile Properties dialog, select the Physical I/O tab.

procedure.title: Assigning a Network Device to an LPAR

step.para: Open the HMC application and go to Server and Partition Server Management.
From the available servers, open the server and partition to install.
Right-click the profile to use for installation and select Properties—see .
In the Logical Partition Profile Properties dialog, select the Physical I/O tab.
From Managed system I/O devices, select PCI 10/100/1000Mbps Ethernet UTP 2-port from the bus where it is installed. Then click Add as required.

sect3.para: Create a network installation source if &sls; should be installed on a number of partitions. This eliminates the need to change CDs during installation. The same source can also be used for concurrent installation of various systems. The configuration of the network installation source is described in .

sect3.title: Starting the Installation
sect3.para: To start the installation, reboot the system. Right-click the profile name, select Activate, and press OK in the following dialog.

To read the installation data from a network install source rather than continuing the installation from the CD-ROM (see ), append the option manual to the name of the kernel (install).
For an installation over VNC, append the parameters vnc=1 and vncpassword=password to the name of the kernel (install). Read more about VNC in .
